nodes.bodyText: this yoda syntax is super strange to read
Where did you get the best practice to use " instead '?

That's actually not a best-practice :) However, if given a choice either to have consistency or to conform, then I choose consistency. So the reasoning behind using double-quotes over single-quotes is because the Dart generator wraps string values with double-quotes.
So I would rather see double-quotes in the generated code all over the place, instead of having inconsistency.
Makes sense?
Same here why " not '? All dart src examples use ' https://dart.dev/guides/language/effective-dart/style
You are mixing styles here as well, one liner trinary operator vs. multiline. Personally I prefer multiline as it's easier to quickly scan code while scrolling.

Ask dartfmt; it'll opt to either have the trinary operator on one line, or as I wrote it above.
I almost never see the previous style in the wild, namely:
  ps.isNotEmpty ? '?' + ps.join('&')
    : '';
I'm not convinced we should be correcting method type. Most languages do not do it, found it in only 2 other templates.
Here again, I've seen import ' (single quote), but this line has " - inconsistent style.
This import using ' again - which I think is correct, but pointing out lack of consistency.
dart1 has been removed now. looks like your branch isn't up to date with upstream master
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3,11 +3,10 @@ title: Config Options for dart-dio
 sidebar_label: dart-dio
 ---
 
-These options may be applied as additional-properties (cli) or configOptions (plugins). Refer to [configuration docs](https://openapi-generator.tech/docs/configuration) for more details.
-
 | Option | Description | Values | Default |
 | ------ | ----------- | ------ | ------- |
 |allowUnicodeIdentifiers|boolean, toggles whether unicode identifiers are allowed in names or not, default is false| |false|
+|browserClient|Is the client browser based (for Dart 1.x only)| |null|
